verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Lemuel, <S%H3927><s%> the prophecy <S%H4853><s%> that his mother <S%H517><s%> taught <S%H3256><s%> him.
What, <S%H4100><s%> my son? <S%H1248><s%> and what, <S%H4100><s%> the son <S%H1248><s%> of my womb? <S%H990><s%> and what, <S%H4100><s%> the son <S%H1248><s%> of my vows? <S%H5088><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> not your strength <S%H2428><s%> to women, <S%H802><s%> nor your ways <S%H1870><s%> to that which destroys <S%H4229><s%> kings. <S%H4428><s%>

It is not for kings, <S%H4428><s%> O Lemuel, <S%H3927><s%> it is not for kings <S%H4428><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine; <S%H3196><s%> nor <S%H408><s%> for princes <S%H7336><s%> strong drink: <S%H7941><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> they drink, <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> the law, <S%H2710><s%> and pervert <S%H8138><s%> the judgment <S%H1779><s%> of any <S%H3605><s%> of the afflicted. <S%H6040><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%> to him that is ready <S%H4131><s%> to perish, <S%H6><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> to those that be of heavy <S%H4751><s%> hearts. <S%H5315><s%>
Let him drink, <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> his poverty, <S%H7389><s%> and remember <S%H2142><s%> his misery <S%H5999><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more. <S%H5750><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> for the dumb <S%H483><s%> in the cause <S%H1779><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> such as are appointed <S%H1121><s%> to destruction. <S%H2475><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> judge <S%H8199><s%> righteously, <S%H6664><s%> and plead <S%H1777><s%> the cause of the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy. <S%H34><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> can find <S%H4672><s%> a virtuous <S%H2428><s%> woman? <S%H802><s%> for her price <S%H4377><s%> is far <S%H7350><s%> above rubies. <S%H6443><s%>
The heart <S%H3820><s%> of her husband <S%H1167><s%> does safely trust <S%H982><s%> in her, so that he shall have no <S%H3808><s%> need <S%H2637><s%> of spoil. <S%H7998><s%>
She will do <S%H1580><s%> him good <S%H2896><s%> and not evil <S%H7451><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of her life. <S%H2416><s%>
She seeks <S%H1875><s%> wool, <S%H6785><s%> and flax, <S%H6593><s%> and works <S%H6213><s%> willingly <S%H2656><s%> with her hands. <S%H3709><s%>
She is like the merchants' <S%H5503><s%> ships; <S%H591><s%> she brings <S%H935><s%> her food <S%H3899><s%> from afar. <S%H4801><s%>

She rises <S%H6965><s%> also while it is yet <S%H5750><s%> night, <S%H3915><s%> and gives <S%H5414><s%> meat <S%H2964><s%> to her household, <S%H1004><s%> and a portion <S%H2706><s%> to her maidens. <S%H5291><s%>
She considers <S%H2161><s%> a field, <S%H7704><s%> and buys <S%H3947><s%> it: with the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of her hands <S%H3709><s%> she plants <S%H5195><s%> a vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>
She girds <S%H2296><s%> her loins <S%H4975><s%> with strength, <S%H5797><s%> and strengthens <S%H553><s%> her arms. <S%H2220><s%>
She perceives <S%H2938><s%> that her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> is good: <S%H2896><s%> her candle <S%H5216><s%> goes <S%H3518><s%> not out by night. <S%H3915><s%>
She lays <S%H7971><s%> her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the spindle, <S%H3601><s%> and her hands <S%H3709><s%> hold <S%H8551><s%> the distaff. <S%H6418><s%>
She stretches <S%H6566><s%> out her hand <S%H3709><s%> to the poor; <S%H6041><s%> yes, she reaches <S%H7971><s%> forth <S%H6566><s%> her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the needy. <S%H34><s%>
She is not afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the snow <S%H7950><s%> for her household: <S%H1004><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> her household <S%H1004><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with scarlet. <S%H8144><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> herself coverings <S%H4765><s%> of tapestry; her clothing <S%H3830><s%> is silk <S%H8336><s%> and purple. <S%H713><s%>
Her husband <S%H1167><s%> is known <S%H3045><s%> in the gates, <S%H8179><s%> when he sits <S%H3427><s%> among <S%H5973><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> fine linen, <S%H5466><s%> and sells <S%H4376><s%> it; and delivers <S%H5414><s%> girdles <S%H2290><s%> to the merchant. <S%H5503><s%>
Strength <S%H5797><s%> and honor <S%H1926><s%> are her clothing; <S%H3830><s%> and she shall rejoice <S%H7832><s%> in time <S%H3117><s%> to come. <S%H314><s%>
She opens <S%H6605><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> with wisdom; <S%H2451><s%> and in her tongue <S%H3956><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> of kindness. <S%H2617><s%>
She looks <S%H6822><s%> well <S%H6822><s%> to the ways <S%H1979><s%> of her household, <S%H1004><s%> and eats <S%H398><s%> not the bread <S%H3899><s%> of idleness. <S%H6104><s%>
Her children <S%H1121><s%> arise <S%H6965><s%> up, and call <S%H833><s%> her blessed; <S%H833><s%> her husband <S%H1167><s%> also, and he praises <S%H1984><s%> her.
Many <S%H7227><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%> have done <S%H6213><s%> virtuously, <S%H2428><s%> but you excel <S%H5927><s%> them all. <S%H3605><s%>

Favor <S%H2580><s%> is deceitful, <S%H8267><s%> and beauty <S%H3308><s%> is vain: <S%H1892><s%> but a woman <S%H802><s%> that fears <S%H3373><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> she shall be praised. <S%H1984><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> her of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of her hands; <S%H3027><s%> and let her own works <S%H4639><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> her in the gates. <S%H8179><s%>
